titleStmt.title: Magia adamica or the antiquitie of magic, and the descent thereof from Adam downwards, proved. Whereunto is added a perfect, and full discoverie of the true cœlum terræ, or the magician's heavenly chaos, and first matter of all things. By Eugenius Philalethes.
titleStmt.author: Vaughan, Thomas, 1622-1666.

titleStmt.title: Magia adamica or the antiquitie of magic, and the descent thereof from Adam downwards, proved. Whereunto is added a perfect, and full discoverie of the true cœlum terræ, or the magician's heavenly chaos, and first matter of all things. By Eugenius Philalethes.
titleStmt.author: Vaughan, Thomas, 1622-1666.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T.W. for H. Blunden, at the Castle in Corn-hill,

notesStmt.note: Possibly intended to be issued with "The man-mouse taken in a trap, and tortur'd to death for gnawing the margins of Eugenius Philalethes" (Wing V153A) which includes errata for "Magia adamica".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
